text: Work hard to get what you like, otherwise you'll be forced to just like what you get
author: Bernard Show

text: In the End, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends.
author: Martin Luter King

text: Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.
author: Konfuciy

text: Great spirits have always encountered violent opposition from mediocre minds.
author: Albert Einstein

text: And if you gaze long into an abyss, the abyss also gazes into you.
author: Fridrih Nicshe

text: Only two things we'll regret on deathbed – that we are a little loved and little traveled.
author: Mark Twen

text: It’s not the years in your life that count. It’s the life in your years.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Only two things are infinite — the universe and human stupidity, and I’m not sure about the former.
author: Albert Einstein

text: We do not remember days, we remember moments.
author: John Duo
